website_summaries.verdict: This box-style plug cover helps keep your plugged-in items from getting pulled out of the wall.
pros: Very difficult for little hands to be able to open
Requires pushing on 2 buttons to open
Space inside the box can handle a night light or a large plug
cons: The interior of the box is not big enough to handle a sideways-square plug

customer_reviews.title: Keep little hands safe
customer_reviews.text: I love this outlet cover! My 8 month old can't keep his little crawling hands off anything. This solved some serious concerns. I love that you have to push the buttons on both the top and bottom at the same time to open. We ran cable covers out the bottom hole so our little one can't pull on the cords at all. Bot is a little bulky, but that's to be expected as it needs to provide room for the cord's depth when plugged in. We will be buying more of these soon.
customer_reviews.author: LilStarlet

customer_reviews.title: Works well for standard plugs.
customer_reviews.text: This outlet cover unfortunately doesn't allow the sideways rectanglugar plugs to fit without crushing the cable. Luckily I can buy a converter for the plug. It works well for standard and square shaped plugs.
customer_reviews.author: leen

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this today, it is exactly what I needed! I chose this particular model because my power strip plug goes into the socket at an angle and this cord opening is slightly to the right (see photos). It's still a little snug for this when plugged into the bottom outlet, but perfect when on the top. Baby has tried to break it open a few times already without success. It's pricey but the protection is worth it! I will update if any problems occur with continued use.
customer_reviews.author: NurseJ

customer_reviews.title: This product is great for keep little ones from unplugging & attempting to ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for keep little ones from unplugging & attempting to plug things back in. I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because I really wish it was a little wider so it could be used for items that have to be sideways, like the adapter in my picture.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha H

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for child proofing
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution for what I needed it for. The nursery has one plug that I needed the baby monitor plugged in to. So I needed something to cover that outlet while allowing me to still use it. The profile on this is semi deep, so if you're backing furniture up to it, be aware that your furniture will be sticking out from the wall a little bit. But it is not an issue with me. I also paired it with a separate purchase of an adhesive cord cover to keep the baby monitor cord from dangling. Easy enough for an adult to get in to, but in my opinion, impossible for a baby/toddler to get into. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Robin Brzezinski

customer_reviews.title: Love this cover!
customer_reviews.text: My 8month old and 2 year old love to pull the plugs out. I reviewed some other items and decided to go with this one because of how big it is inside when closed. I was shocked at how easy this was to install it took two minutes. You just need a screwdriver. It comes with two face plates for the outlets. My 8 month old can pull on the cord without it coming loose at all and now she just ignores it completely
customer_reviews.author: Vanah

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Three days after the return window ended, our almost 3 year old figured out how to open it and proceeded to put stuff in the outlets. Yes, it was closed completely. Yes, it was secured to the wall. No, I would not recommend this. Maybe it works great for under 3 but you will have to buy a different one after.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Opening and closing is finicky - quality is ?
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very easy to install, large "box" size accommodates large plug heads Cons: Opening and especially shutting the front panels is finicky. Needed to jostle the button tab on one panel (at top and bottom), to the receiving hole on the other panel (at top and bottom), to get it to "snap" close. It's not hard, but worrying that with continual jostling over time that the plastic halves on the hinges will break. The plastic is fairly thin, compared with a similar product. Didn't like the finicky opening/closing, and ended up returning this. Got the Wappa Baby outlet cover box, which seems more durable (definitely easier to open and close, and liked the additional "locking" wheel feature).
customer_reviews.author: wadiefong

customer_reviews.title: Limited Space
customer_reviews.text: They do the job. However, very limited space inside. Many of the USB charges will not fit because they are too long. Your stuck with the two outlets, no muliports, and the cords have to go a certain way or they don't fit. Just need to be bigger. I looked for bigger and did not find anything. So these work within that constraint. They are tricky to close. The top closes easy enough, but the bottom has to be pushed up to get it to clip. I have about 6 of these now and they all have the same issue when closing. The little guy sees these and doesn't even try to get into it. And he is into everything.
customer_reviews.author: L. Arney

customer_reviews.title: Alexa doesn't get pulled out now!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. We have twin infants who are in to everything, including ripping plugs out of the walls. We bought one of these about 2 months ago and installed it for our Alexa, they haven't been able to disconnect her anymore.... So, we just installed a second one tonight for our robot vacuum, hopefully with the same results! Very easy to install, door stays shut well!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Babies can still open it
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old can pull on them and open it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Trevillyan

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant because the price of these, so I first bought a cheaper kind. Well unfortunately the cheap one didn't work and then I realized why these were priced higher. First off all these came with 2 different back plates. That means you can use them with any type of outlet ( round two opening, or rectangle 1 opening with 2 outlets). Second these have way more room inside which allows for cord storage and bigger plug ins to fit. the cheap one don't do either of those things. It's worth the extra price.
customer_reviews.author: KatelynTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: 2yo got cover open easily
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else eyeballing this product, I have large plugs that I wanted to secure, but this product is scary. I installed this in my 2yo's room and two days later he knew how to get it open. It doesn't require much strength to get the doors open once your kid figures it out and that's its down fall. I caught my son trying to plug his nightlight in after he opened the cover on his own. I'm thankful nothing happened.
customer_reviews.author: Lacour

customer_reviews.title: like those for coax and ethernet ports
customer_reviews.text: Works well to cover plugged in items, especially when you run plastic channel to hid the cords and keep away from the kids. I had a little trouble with non-outlet covers, like those for coax and ethernet ports. But here's the work around: ignore the outlet cover with this kit, and just use the native coax cover. Its bigger and won't fit in the grooves like the plate in the kit, but by re-installing INSIDE this outlet box cover you'll essentially clamp it in place. It worked for me and now I have outlets and communication ports covered for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: SearchDude

customer_reviews.title: bulky but safe
customer_reviews.text: This does the job for a standard outlet and a small plug, but if your plug has a chunky adapter it probably won't fit. We got these for our AC plugs. It fits the small unit well, but we can't plug anything else in with it, so we lose an outlet. It did NOT fit out large AC unit that takes a 200 plug. They are a bulky, so a bit of an eyesore; for me, baby safety is more important though. Close nicely. Easy for adults to open, but 2 yr old hasn't figure it out yet. I got 2 and returned 1 which was easy.
customer_reviews.author: SLStitt

customer_reviews.title: Weird Design
customer_reviews.text: The clips are on opposite sides of the doors making it hard to get them open. I had to use the handles of two wooden spoons to press the buttons (since they have to be pushed at the same time) in order to get the necessary pressure. I don't know if the box kid proof, but it's surely adult proof! I think the box would be nearly impossible for someone with arthritis to open. Since I'm using the device to block cold and not as a safety device, I'm going to cut the clips off. The clam shell doors stay closed without them. Otherwise the box is fine.
customer_reviews.author: wmt

customer_reviews.title: Works for cat owners.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my cats a litter robot and they kept unplugging it. (the outlet is older and a little loose and the power supply brick is heavy). This helped keep them from constantly unplugging it. They also like to chew on the cord so I keep the excess cord inside the box. It's a little tricky to get it to close properly with a larger brick and extra cord, but it will fit and stay closed. I don't have kids so no idea how well it keeps them safe, but this definitely works for cat owners. 🤣
customer_reviews.author: Addicted To Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for children
customer_reviews.text: I’m shocked how easily this broke and how the doors pop off. This is absolutely not safe to keep children away from outlets. The doors can easily be pulled off the side hinges rendering this completely useless and unsafe. Complete waste of money and a false sense of security and safety.
customer_reviews.author: Kryssy

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but concerned about safety
customer_reviews.text: My wife ordered this for our child's room. Great idea but cheaply made. I have no doubt that any toddler or soon to be walking baby could tear this off the wall without effort. I would not feel safe leaving our baby alone with this as a safety device. More likely to tear it off and have full access to the electrical outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Toddler figured it out almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: I must have a genius kid because he figured it out almost immediately. It doesn't close properly either, it's very hard to get it to line up and close right. It seems secure enough, but the buttons were too easy to figure out. I might put tape over them and see if I can just permanently lock it. Or maybe zip ties through the holes.
customer_reviews.author: Kim R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and great peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I bought these unsure if they were going to work because we have an older home where some of the outlets are only two prong so we have to use a converter piece (never ideal) which sticks out even further. This box fits perfectly for our situation and is way easier to deal with than the old school ones. It’s gives us great peace of mind and when paired with a wire cover there is zero chance of my littles grabbing at dangerous cords.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: our 4 year old with special needs was able to rip the door off in a matter of seconds
customer_reviews.text: This outlet box definitely did not fit the larger items we needed to plug in like the picture showed. In addition, our 4 year old with special needs was able to rip the door off in a matter of seconds. I would not purchase again more recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Miller

customer_reviews.title: Won’t work for horizontal plugs but definitely baby proof
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install, just like changing the face plate of a regular outlet. No need to change the outlet itself. Only draw back is that it doesn’t fit bigger plugs that go sideways (horizontal). I ended up having to plug a power strip in and then plug the cameras in to that. Works great and holds up to little fingers as the plug is unfortunately right next to my daughters crib and she hasn’t been able to open it, despite her best efforts!
customer_reviews.author: VeggieNurse

customer_reviews.title: At ease
customer_reviews.text: Was super easy to install. I was able to do it myself. It feels sturdy. It’s a little difficult to open with one hand so that’s perfect. Means my child will definitely have difficulty. However It is easy to open with both hands. I will update once I attach bigger plugs. So far I am enjoying this product and I feel at ease that my child won’t try to pull the cords or stick his littler fingers in the electrical outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Came in handy for safety purposes
customer_reviews.text: I like this cover. I actually bought it to keep my small kitten away from the outlet and extension cords. Pretty much versatile. I like that it’s big enough because I used some pretty thick cords, it barely fits, but it works, so that works for me! I’m able to close it completely. As far as the cords outside of this product / cover I am using cord covers. But this product was a great solution for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: C C

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough for AC plugs
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought this to cover an outlet that our baby monitor and white noise machines are plugged into. Both have long rectangular AC plugs. The box inside was not wide enough for the baby monitor plug, there was no way to actually get the plug into the outlet with the box in the way. We needed another few millimeters and we would have been fine. We'll either return it or find another place to use it, somewhere with a regular plug.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Do the Job
customer_reviews.text: These are smart and do the job. They take a little wiggling to get closed sometimes - but I'll settle for that for the peace of mind knowing my baby's not gonna get inside. They actually made out outlets look a lot smarter than they were without - even with the extra "bulk". I also loved that they came with both faceplate styles (all but 2 of mine at home were one only to discover I needed the other type - so it was a welcome discovery) AND they'll travel to my next home too.
customer_reviews.author: Level Mike

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and Missing parts - do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The product is missing the faceplate for the 3-pin socket pair. This is a major inconvenience as the power adapters won’t go in fully into the socket due to the gap created by installing the box behind an existing socket faceplate. It’s a lot of money for a product which is missing an important part. Also the plastic quality is substandard compared to the price of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Nammy

customer_reviews.title: Great in theory, doesn't work in real life
customer_reviews.text: The box and closing mechanism are solid, well built and easy to install. However, the box sticks out quite a bit and draws attention to itself and any cord coming out of it. My baby is constantly touching it and trying to pull himself up on it which defeats the purpose of not having to closely monitor his every move when he is in that area of the room. I ended up removing the box and blocking the outlet with a piece of furniture. Did not work for me at all.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Not for babies but because Dad has dementia
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these to prevent my Dad from unplugging his power strip behind his television which consequently shut down his camera/monitoring system. The other is used in his garage to prevent him from opening the bay doors (covers the doorbell-style opener buttons) and getting outside through the garage - he's a wanderer and gets easily lost. The brain is a strange organ. These have helped immensely.
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: Really Like These
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I tried the Safety First one's before this, and they just were not big enough for anything other than a standard plug. So if you had a power strip, they were too small. This, though, is big enough, and they look really nice. I was worried they would look too industrial or something, but they actually cleaned up all the plugs. Plus, they definitely keep little fingers out. The buttons snap into place and take some good pushing to get it open.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: Work really well to keep your little one from the outlets.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and I’m very with the purchased. One warning for other buyer is to check the plug type you have before buying. The product will accommodate most small/slim plug. Sadly I was not able to use this cover with my dual usb charger for my iphone because the charge block is too big :( . Also a 25ft extension power cable will barely fit inside this product (just an fyi). With that being said, the product work very well at keeping your little from pulling or playing with the outlet. Highly recommend other parents this product over the plug for outlets.
customer_reviews.author: long mach

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I have an outlet right behind my daughters crib that I HAD to use for the baby monitor and her light to plug into but both plugs were larger and I was very worried about this location. My daughter is almost 2 now and this has definitely done the job. It seems very safe and she cannot get into it. Just what I was looking for! Definitely puts my mind at ease!
customer_reviews.author: jacktrade88

customer_reviews.title: Easy and effective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for my living room to house our alarm system base plug. I needed something to cover it so my little kiddos couldn’t constantly rip it out if the outlet. Works like a charm. I would say the only “problem” with it is that the box is not tall enough to accommodate two plugs with bigger specialty heads vs the standard ones with just the little prongs. So this double outlet is only capable of one plug.
customer_reviews.author: tflann88

customer_reviews.title: DIY for a horizontal power block.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping the horizontal plug on the Hatch Baby Rest would fit inside the box. No such luck. So I used a very fine tooth saw to cut it. It’s not pretty and I’ll meet to cover the irregular edges with electrical tape. If you have two regular vertical power blocks it probably won’t work without a little DIY either. One power block and one regular plug would be fine. I have been unable to find a solution for a horizontal power block so this is the best I could do. Perhaps an upgrade to this item includes punch outs for irregular plugs.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Nice, wish they were a little larger....
customer_reviews.text: These work well for wrapping very small cables and/or utilizing standard plugs. If you happen to have a AC/DC power adaptor, you wont fit it inside this box. Also, anything other than like 22 ga cable won't easily exit the openings on the bottom - a standard power cord is way too thick and you have to pinch it to close the box which isn't ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Web Geek

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to keep my toddlers from unplugging my lamps! I love that this cover attaches to the plate cover- keeps it secure and impossible for my child to rip it off the wall. Also comes with two plate cover styles so you can use it no matter which style you have. I was able to push the extra cord from one lamp up into the box. Awesome. My other lamp I used some electrical cord cover which worked great as well. These covers ARE rather large. But I chose this particular style so I could accommodate larger plugs such as USB and extension cords.
customer_reviews.author: Jami H

customer_reviews.title: Toddler/Babyproof Outlet Solution!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the only device that has held up to my 1 year old twins' curiosity and destruction! It helps us keep cords plugged in for their baby monitors and other devices. We simply used this in combination with a wall cord cover and there's no more playing with cords and outlets with the babies! It's not the prettiest to look at, but it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, works great
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. Super easy to install. The fit when closing is a bit odd, but if you push up on the bottom of one side (cannot remember which side) it snaps into place just fine. A bit of a challenge to open up (not super hard, but I mean...its a little bit of a task...you know....so kids cant easily open it.) So, all in all, great product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: not toddler proof
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for one of the exposed outlets in my sons room where his tv is plugged into. He is 2.5 years old and every night would consistently open the doors up on his own. I ended up drilling 2 small holes in each door and zip-tying them shut. Its a lot bigger than it has to be, if you're not plugging in power blocks then you definitely don't need this large of a model.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lentz

customer_reviews.title: Finally, no more pulled cords
customer_reviews.text: This outlet cover is a must have! My 17 months old kep pulling the cords out of the plugs and constantly kept playing around the outlets, I was very nervous all the time. This cover madey life a little bit easier and less stressful. It's very easy to install and it works great, the only thing that does not fit is my phone charger, i have a bigger one from google pixel, their ac adapters are pretty big not like apple's. But not a big deal. I'll be bying more of these for the rest of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Great outlet cover that fits thicker cables.
customer_reviews.text: This door outlet cover is very easy to install, engage, and disengage. The main reason I love it is because the hole for the cables are large enough for two thick power cables from two power strips to fit through. The previous door outlet cover that I purchased from BabiesRus, although cheaper and came in a two-pack, was too slim to even plug in the power strip cables and the hole to route the cable too small for both cables. I just wish these were a little more inexpensive or came in a two-pack so I can put a few more around the house.
customer_reviews.author: m00nshake

customer_reviews.title: Baby-proofing Godsend!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! Our one year old keeps grabbing for the outlets and we put in outlet covers, but we kept coming across the problem of what to do with things that need to be plugged in in her space, like the baby monitor. This solves the problem! It fits the bulky adapters just fine and stops her from grabbing. Definitely a good option for baby proofing a room.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C.

customer_reviews.title: works!
customer_reviews.text: this was exactly what i needed to keep my 1 year old from pulling out plugs and possibly hurting himself. he is great about figuring out how to get past/around the obstacles i put in his way for safety or just to limit his access, but this one has survived. he can open on of our child gates but hasn't figured this electrical cover yet.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Super Rough-Toddler Safe!
customer_reviews.text: Love these!! Very simple to install. Just remove the original outlet plate and place the box over and the provided outlet plate and screw it in. Installed two of these in 5 minutes and toddler tested! I have a Google Home Assistant plugged into one and USB charger in the other. It's a tight fit to close the box due to the specific USB charger plug I have, but I still managed to close it. Wire opening is pointing upwards so toddler can't pull on the cord too. The other one is installed with wire opening facing downwards for the office. Simple, attractive, and it works!
customer_reviews.author: SpicyShrimp

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my toddler son from unplugging important cords for my office. The setup was easy and it has an elegant look to it were you don't get distracted by it when you walk in the room. When I set it up, my son went over to his regular routine and when we saw it, he tried opening it... but after only a few seconds he moved on to the next thing. It was a success! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Frequent Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Its okay
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed. Although for the most part it would prevent most little ones from getting to the outlets early on. Nevertheless, this product is a little flimsy and would not keep a very determined 20 month old out. The buttons are a bit tricky to manually operate, but it is not strong enough to withstand a good strong tug. Oh well, guess nothing is made with the quality to last anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Mom

customer_reviews.title: If you need the outlet, buy THIS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a few different ones, considering some outlets have plug-ins that never get moved (cable box/tv) The cheaper ones are fine for those. However, if you need to plug in/out frequently (i.e.vacuum) this is the best one I have found. It looks sleek and fits those bigger items. It actually looks better with the cover so it might be permanent!
customer_reviews.author: Lori7

customer_reviews.title: Works with MOST bulkier plugs!
customer_reviews.text: This outlet cover is the only one I found of 4 that I tried that actually works with a bulkier surge protector plug, the ridiculously large monitor camera plug or oversized Roku plug. It is a little bulky/takes up a bit of real estate on the wall, but I don’t think it could be any smaller and still accommodate jumbo plugs. 4 stars instead of 5 because I wish it came with plate to be able to use with round outlet (for window unit air conditioner plug.)
customer_reviews.author: Julia M.

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I needed a box to hide my 2 adapters. This one is the best I can find. I was not able to fit the original Nest IQ Outdoor plug and a regular small sized adapter used for the Nest Hello bell. I had to get a smaller adapter for the IQ Outdoor. With the smaller plug I was able to also hide the excess wiring inside as well.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: The only outlet on the wall is where our crib is located. This completely blocks off the outlet while allowing me to plug in the monitor. I also used some wire mold wire covers to prevent little hands from grabbing the wire. Install was pretty easy, Just need to remove the existing cover and screw in this new cover.
customer_reviews.author: Tony B

customer_reviews.title: Hard to close
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to close and a really smart and persistent kid will eventually open it but you would be able to catch them in time. Of course you need to also buy another product to cover the wire for it to study be useful because the wire will still be lose outside - so i recommend a cable cover kit!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product. My toddler was able to get it open in 3 minutes. He was able to press the button on the top and get the top part to slightly open enough for his fingers to fit in which pinched them and forced it open. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: ... of the outlet but the fit and finish is nice. You certainly can fit large cords and adapters ...
customer_reviews.text: My child is still under a year old so I can't vouch for the durability or strength of the outlet but the fit and finish is nice. You certainly can fit large cords and adapters under this cover which makes it ideal for many semi-permanent situations where you leave cord plugged in most of the time. I only use these for outlets that must have cords plugged into them constantly (such as a lamp) when hiding the outlet with furniture is not an option. If you plug and unplug from the outlet often I would recommend another product instead of this outlet box: self-closing outlet covers.
customer_reviews.author: Cloud Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not Child Proof!
customer_reviews.text: Do not get this! My year and a half old was able to figure out the button on this and get into it. He broke the top securing latch and instantly was in it. It’s not durable or baby/child proof at all!
customer_reviews.author: Maranda

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep our 2-year old from unplugging the video camera/baby monitor in his room. I love that you need to push the two buttons simultaneously in order to open it - so, it will certainly take a while for him to outsmart this thing. I'm especially rating this 5 stars, because it was SO easy to install and seems to be really sturdy! The plug on the camera is very boxy yet this box still allowed enough room for it to fit without straining the cord or trying to manipulate the plug!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: It only took two days for him to figure out ...
customer_reviews.text: It only took two days for him to figure out how to open it. That said, I was able to get him to stop unplugging lamps etc by adding a usb splitter in front of this and giving him all kids of USB toys to plug into it. I told him everything that plugged into USB was his responsibility and I would do the electrical plugs. Negotiating with a 2 year old... but, it worked!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is true to color and was super easy to install. It has a wider inner dimension and was able to accommodate the larger plugs in my son's nursery. The doors can be a little tricky to latch all the way, but otherwise a great product. I wish they were slightly more affordable because I would install them all over my house.
customer_reviews.author: Riley A.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for Baby Monitor, Amazon Echo and Google Wifi
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for our needs. We tried a different model, but the plug would not fit. It was also great that this included both types of outlet covers - we have the square plugs which were hard to find on the other covers. We were able to fit a baby monitor cord in one and an Amazon Echo Plug and a Google Wifi Plug in the other. All were large size plugs and fit without an issue. Definitely a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Amy M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and it saved my cat from exile
customer_reviews.text: Finally able to outsmart my plug-pulling pet! Cat, April, kept pulling out this one particular plug behind the bed which was a real hassle to get back in. This solved that, and it was so simple to install. I love this solution. Who is laughing now, April? Me! And I am gloating. Hahaha!
customer_reviews.author: Domivel

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that works with all plug shapes
customer_reviews.text: We had tried so many similar products that just didn’t work with this plug or that plug - very frustrating! But FINALLY we have these, which I’ve installed to cover three different outlets in our kids’ rooms, and they work great no matter the plug shape. Love these!!!
customer_reviews.author: ipr151

customer_reviews.title: My toddlers got it open.
customer_reviews.text: This product is a great idea. Unfortunately they were easy to get off for my 2 year old twins. They are thin and it did not take a full day before my boys had found a weak spot and exploited it. I put these in their room to replace the safety first outlet covers that they figured out. Unfortunately they have the same weakness. The doors will give and become easy to pull open if hit in just the right spot. One of my boys completely removed one door before I got back there to stop them.
customer_reviews.author: Hmmmm

customer_reviews.title: Wont fit Infant Optics Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt work with the most popular baby monitor plug in, the infant optics (amazons choice)... rendering it useless to me. Returning. So sad that I have not found one, after hours of searching, that will fit "the" baby monitor?
customer_reviews.author: Amber G

customer_reviews.title: Baby-Proofing Necessity
customer_reviews.text: We bought these when we were moving our toddler from a crib to a bed and wanted his room as safe as possible. I had the hardest time finding outlet covers that allowed things to be plugged in, and would fit our modern square face plates. This cover has two face plate options, which fit our plug-ins perfectly, and took two minutes to install. It covers the plugs completely, and organizes the chords.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Good for bulky wires/plugs
customer_reviews.text: What I most like about this protector is that you can plug bulky box plugs into it. I had to smush my phone charger into it, but it fit, unlike other's I've bought. I can plug the baby monitor into it, and it fits. (most come with the plugs with the 'adapter' type box that goes into the wall.) If I got a phone charger that faced the usb part to the side, I wouldn't even have to "smush" it shut. My 1 y/o was not able to open it and gave up trying to pull the plugs out after about 1.5 hrs of installation.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for child/animal proofing
customer_reviews.text: I got this to cover the outlet to protect my rabbit. He is very naughty. This outlet is directly over his litter box so I needed to cover it. He picks the place so I can't move the box. It was incredibly easy to install! Usually my husband does this kind of thing in the house, I'm always afraid I'll screw it up but he has been busy and I needed light. Incredibly easy, even with someone with brain damage can install it and handle the child proofing.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Ludeman

customer_reviews.title: Solid protection against baby’s prying fingers!
customer_reviews.text: Uses: Keeping mah baby boy from getting electrocuted! Only use it for outlets that are plugged in. Pros: Easy installation, solid lock that really seals the plugs in well. Should fit most plugs because there’s plenty of room. Cons: If it doesn’t properly align, it won’t completely close. I close the right door first, then the left, and that usually solves the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Space Unicorn

customer_reviews.title: It is not child proof!!
customer_reviews.text: I am really unhappy with this product. I bought it because my 18 month old is naturally curious about the plugs and outlets in his room. He was able to easily force the box open and pulled out the plug. It is extremely dangerous to market your product for child safety and then not deliver. My child could have been hurt. Thank G-d nothing happened.
customer_reviews.author: Mom101

customer_reviews.title: Just what my baby didn't want
customer_reviews.text: Previously had a sliding outlet plate in our TV outlet. Baby was constantly touching cord and it would come out just enough to loose power. Switched to this and now it doesn't matter if she touches the cord, it doesn't come out of the outlet and she has less interest in the cord. This works with both standard and decora outlets-just pick the plate that you need and snap it into the cover. I did install mine upside down so the cable could come out the top since it wasn't long enough to come out the bottom and around the box.
customer_reviews.author: Christina B

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the plug ins you have are not sideways
customer_reviews.text: Well I thought these would work for side ways plug in items like a phone charger but that was a no go... It works for what it says but it would have been nice if it would work for that. Oh well should have paid closer attention.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine Mills

customer_reviews.title: Super deep, Extra large, 100% happy!
customer_reviews.text: I’m SUPER happy with this purchase!!!! This is perfect! I recently purchased a similar product by another company that was too narrow for the outlet itself and to shallow for my cords. This one is wonderful! It is super deep and much wider than the area needing to be covered! Very easy to install! As you can see in the photo, my baby cannot get it open! (I did install it upside down on purpose because of how I plan to secure the cords) It’s a little pricier than some of the competitors’ products but it is 100% worth it! Would definitely recommend and purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: the pattsy

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for the clean look and durability !
customer_reviews.text: I used these to conceal unsightly outlets that sit in the middle of my room. I don’t have kids. I don’t recommend for plugs you want to unplug daily as it requires 2 hands. They are very good designs. I do wish they were a bit wider and a bit more depth. They come with 2 different plates. If you need to plug in anything wider then the outlet plate, this won’t work for you. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: liljsully

customer_reviews.title: 2 minute install!
customer_reviews.text: This took approximately 2 minutes to install and covered up a huge plug in our nursery. Even though the box is kind of big, the door still opened and didn’t even hit this box behind it. Simple to open for adults but a child definitely won’t be able to open. 100% happy.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Big, but effective
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the Safety 1st brand had a lot of bad reviews. These are as advertised and are plenty big for putting large plugs in. However, I found them a little too big and my daughter kept playing with it because they are so bulky that its hard to ignore them. With kids I've found the the less intrusive the item, the less interesting and more effective. If you have a big plug these will be your saving grace because the Safety 1st won't hold any plug with a box around the plug.
customer_reviews.author: Madtown

customer_reviews.title: Love how easy it is to install
customer_reviews.text: Works great! This product is easily installed. All you do is unscrew the current outlet plate cover. Then place the box with doors open wide. Place the new outlet plate cover on top and screw it in instead. The doors hinge close easily and open with little adult effort by pressing the top and bottom tabs in. The cords can be directed up or down depending how you install the box. Easy solution to child safety concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Transparent Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great safety from cords for ferrets
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to keep the ferrets from getting to the plug. I plugged in two power strips, the width of the two cords barely fit to allow the doors to close, but they were able to close. It has kept the ferrets out and is very unobtrusive in appearance. My walls are white so it blends nicely. The composite is a thin plastic so it would not withstand a great deal of force. It is large enough for the plugs and it is easy to open and close. I do not have children so can not speak to the safety from that perspective. I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: GoingGalt122

customer_reviews.title: Great for baby proofing
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic for anyone with a curious child. Very easy for an adult to open quickly for plugging or unplugging anything but my toddler is unable to open at all. They are kind of bulky but because of the plain color they aren't too obtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Luna Lovegood

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and surge power cords fit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. The surge power cord does fit. Our one year old doesn’t get near it anymore since he doesn’t find it interesting compared to the plugs being exposed! Wish they had one bigger to fit my Samsung sound bar plug!
customer_reviews.author: Bubbly

customer_reviews.title: LOTS of interior space, great design
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked that it fit all my plugs, since I had to use a splitter to plug in three devices. They barely fit, but I was able to close it to keep my young children out. Super easy to install, looks nice, feels sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Zwingli Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and operate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this outlet cover to baby proof our living room. This unit is very install and easy to open. Since you have to hold both buttons at the same time to open, I feel secure knowing that our baby won't be able to open it.
customer_reviews.author: Ames Eggerbee

customer_reviews.title: Big but just not quite big enough
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, however I had two things I needed to plug in, they were both very large charging blocks and it juuuuuust barely didn’t fit so I had to go with a different one. Good quality and pretty big overall!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hecker

customer_reviews.title: Safety for our baby
customer_reviews.text: Babies grow fast and they can figure things out quickly! I needed an innovative plug cover that would work next to his crib! This is a great way to stay safe while plugging needed equipment next to his crib. He has not figured it yet because it locked at the top and bottom and he can not unplug it.
customer_reviews.author: mercedeh namei

customer_reviews.title: Great product! My kids are safe!
customer_reviews.text: It's a really good product. My toddlers stuck a pen through the top button and it broke, but the bottom one still latches and they still can't open it even though it's halfway broke. They are ages 2 and 3. We've had it for about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Solution
customer_reviews.text: We had a power outlet directly behind our son's crib and needed to plug in his monitor camera and sound machine. It is very secure as it screws into the wall, no worries about our MacGyver like son breaking into this Fort Knox.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy installation. It took me about 20 seconds. I just replaced the faceplate that was already there with this. It includes screws but I use the screw that my old face plate was attached with. I have a thick cord coming out of the bottom. My 13 month old has been playing with the Box all day wondering why he can't get to the TV cord.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Butler

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me. I have a two cords plugged into this outlet. One is a standard power strip, the other is a standard electrical cord. It closes around them just fine. The cords do stick out the bottom which my kids do pull on. However they don't get pulled loose from the plugs inside. Both of my 18 month olds have tried to open this without success.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for outlets you need to get to a lot but need to babyproof. The door is reasonably easy for an adult to open but takes some dexterity. We used ours for toddler proofing and have it on an outlet slightly behind a piece of furniture in her room.
customer_reviews.author: Deena Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect outlet cover!
customer_reviews.text: I love this in my sons room. I’m not a fan how bulky it is, but it’s worth it because the plug ins aren’t smashed into the wall. I super easy to install and very sturdy! We’ve had this for a few months and I’ll definitely get more!
customer_reviews.author: Nycole Cross

customer_reviews.title: Great for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I needed a cover for my internet cord so I could move my son's crib in front of the plug safety. I couldn't find anything but this is perfect. The screws did not line up so I only used one but it was enough. If I used this on a typical plug then it would have lined up. It does stick out of the wall quite far but I think it's needed to fit multiple plug sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: We bought 4 of these last year when baby started crawling and decided we needed more now that he can reach other outlets. These are great for the outlets that constantly have something plugged in to prevent him from unplugging or biting the plugs. I like that there is a hole for the cord at the bottom but wish there was on on both ends for versatility.
customer_reviews.author: LaurenTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: We have a plug that our baby monitor had to go in to, but it was right where the openings of our crib was. This outlet protector solved our problem. I was amazed how easy it was to install... literally one screw. It locks great and there is no way a baby can take it off or figure out how to open it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Great Baby Safety Product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! Thank you for solving a problem I didn't know I would have until i had it! Little one desperately wanted to play with the cords/plugs, and this was the best option to prevent that. Super easy to install (thanks for including both faceplates!). Would buy again in a heartbeat (and maybe even for a baby shower gift, too!).
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Deterred mischievous 13 month old
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble keeping my 13 month old from pulling cords out of the outlet. He hasn’t been able to do it since I installed this and honestly once he realized he couldn’t get into it he moved on to other things and hasn’t gone back.
customer_reviews.author: Leanna

customer_reviews.title: Toddler proof.
customer_reviews.text: We had bought one of these to test it out. We have two toddlers that LOVE to mess with plugs. So when we got the first one, it worked so great that we bought more! No more plug pulling and turning our internet off during an important meeting call. 👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Dylan and Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great for the outlet behind my bed
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a baby, but I do have that one annoying outlet that's linked to my room's on/off switch that so happens to be behind the bed. I've always felt unsafe having my bed so close to my lamp's plug considering I have my very flammable bed sheets and pillow case right there. This outlet cover gives me peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Kinda hard to use, but perfect for its purpose.
customer_reviews.text: The buttons take some getting used to, but it will absolutely keep your baby’s fingers out of the sockets.
customer_reviews.author: Nickola Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, easy, worth it
customer_reviews.text: Our son kept somehow unplugging his baby monitor, which was incredibly worrisome because we had no idea he could reach it. Anyway, we purchased this outlet cover. It was easy to install and we had it up in just a couple minutes. You cannot put a price on peace of mind. Will be buying more of these for other outlets around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I've realized I need to clean the wall under my desk because of this outlet box, that said, easy to install, sturdy and simple construction. Buy it, especially if you have a two year old that gets under your desk to unplug your 3D printer when you're 24+ hours into a print!
customer_reviews.author: jaythedogg

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: These hold up well and keep our 16 month old from unplugging the cables. Not sure how long it’ll take before she figures out how to open the box but for now they work great. They were super easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Best box
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few of these sorts of things to test and this won. It's very well made and sturdy. Plus, it will accommodate both types of outlets, unlike some. There's enough room inside for the plugs and when the dogs jump onto the hassock at the front window, it keeps them from coming into contact with the outlet.
customer_reviews.author: pamibe

product_meta.title: Safety Innovations Twin Door Babyproof Outlet Cover Box for Babyproofing Outlets - More Interior Space for Extra Large Electrical Plugs and Adapters - Easy to Install - Easy to Use, (1-Pack)
feature_bullets: BETTER SAFETY AND SECURITY FOR TOTS- Our double locking system (top and bottom buttons) requires two hands to open for better safety. Easy for adults to operate but difficult for babies and toddlers. PLEASE WATCH OUR INSTALLATION VIDEO.
MORE USABLE INTERIOR SPACE THAN ANY OTHER BABYPROOFING BOX COVER- Extra large size and depth for bigger plugs. Inside dimensions measure 5 3/8" High x 3 3/16" Wide x 2 3/4" Deep- All usable space!

EASY INSTALLATION- PLEASE WATCH OUR INSTALLATION VIDEO. All you need is a screwdriver. Takes only minutes to install. Comes with screws and faceplates for installing to both popular outlet styles- Standard/Single Center Screw and Decora/2 Screw (1 Top and 1 Bottom Screw).

KEEP ELECTRICAL PLUGS OUT OF BABY’S REACH- Large, oversized design for childproofing plugs and AC adapters from baby monitors, three prong power cables, surge protectors, USB chargers, power strips, phone and electrical plugs and chargers. Extra large interior has room for cord depth when plugged in. Works with larger cords, power strip plugs, baby monitor plugs.

PEACE OF MIND FOR MOMS, DADS AND GRANDPARENTS- BABYPROOF YOUR ELECTRICAL OUTLETS WITH OUR TWIN DOOR OUTLET COVER SAFETY BOX - Outlet Cover Box hides extra large electrical plugs and adapters and keeps them tucked away and out of your baby’s reach. Prevents your child from unplugging electrical plugs. Protects curious babies, toddlers and young children from getting to electrical outlets and plugs. Perfect solution for bedroom, nursery, kitchen, home office, garage or any other room in your home.
